citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The Licensee employs a part-time Attending Veterinarian who regularly visits the facility to provide care for the animals,
but there was no written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC).
Per this Section of the Regulations, whenever an exhibitor employs an attending veterinarian under part-time or
consultant arrangements, a written PVC is required. The written PVC should include complete and specific details from
the Attending Veterinarian regarding preventative medical care and other health topics to ensure that adequate veterinary
care is provided to the animal species maintained by the Licensee. Correct by 5/12/23.

There was no record of acquisition for the two alpacas that were acquired by the Licensee since the last inspection.
Per this Section of the Regulations, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the
acquisition and disposition of animals in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers and the sources of the
animals. The Licensee needs to prepare a record of acquisition for the 2 alpacas and ensure that the records of
acquisition and disposition are kept current. Correct by 4/14/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
